ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I love Professor Latham. How can you not?
I learned about many bioethics topics and approached them for a political and economic perspective! We also discussed many current events and how they tied into the past.
Developed a capacity to analyze ethical, legal and political questions pertaining to bioethics much more deeply, as well as domain knowledge about specific bioethics issues.
Topics in bioethics such as health disparities, AI applications, global health governance, and human genome editing.
I learned about bioethics and current events especially relevant in todays pandemic world

I learned about different spheres of medicine and bioethical issues that the world faces today. It was incredibly interesting to hear our classes' opinions on gene modification, gun control, and the healthcare system.

This class was really great at presenting current events and issues that fall on the intersection of politics and health. It made bioethics much more topical and the content evolved throughout the semester, allowing us to discuss the progression of cases through the Supreme Court as well as future implications.
I really enjoyed the books we read in this course and the individual research I got to do for my thesis!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Professor Latham is absolutely wonderful, smart, and engaging!

Weaknesses: None, really. As long as you're fine with your grade being reliant on only ONE final essay!

Professor Latham's seminar was absolutely fantastic; I feel so fortunate to have been included in the class and could not have asked for a better way to round out my senior year.  Professor Latham's book selections were riveting, and getting to listen to his reflections on the issues they raise, as well as grapple with ethical, legal and political questions with classmates during seminar discussion, has been a highlight of my semester and Yale education.  Absolutely take this course; it is stellar.

Strengths: The books and articles we read were really interesting and often surprising. Hearing Professor Latham's thoughts and reactions also offered important insights.

Weaknesses: Professor Latham tended to lecture for the majority of class meetings, and there was little discussion among students.
Great discussions

The format of the course as a seminar based on weekly books is strong and enables a lot of discussion. Professor Latham brought in a lot of current events throughout that increased engagement and made the course more flexible.

This course was very strong in discussing current issues with the addition of some historical context. The field of bioethics is evolving as we speak, and the ability to engage with that in class made it even more interesting.
Strengths: this is the perfect class to write your thesis in! The material was engaging and I really learned a lot from Professor Latham and my classmates!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Professor Latham is absolutely amazing and the class was always good vibes.

Professor Latham's seminar was absolutely fantastic; I feel so fortunate to have been included in the class and could not have asked for a better way to round out my senior year.  Professor Latham's book selections were riveting, and getting to listen to his reflections on the issues they raise, as well as grapple with ethical, legal and political questions with classmates during seminar discussion, has been a highlight of my semester and Yale education.  Absolutely take this course; it is stellar.
Yes, Professor Latham is great!
Definitely. Professor Latham is so passionate and knowledgeable
Hands down yes.

I would recommend this class to students who are interested in approaching bioethics from the standpoint of a current event. Being able to engage with this class was very helpful for understanding aspects of the pandemic as well as topics such as abortion rights.
Yes! I loved this course and if you can get a seat in the course, do not give it up! You will love this class
